lead_paragraph: With the Transportation Security Administration struggling with shrinking resources and low staff morale, an expert said that “a structural change is needed.”

byline.contributor: Jeanne Bonner and Mitch Smith contributed reporting, and Kitty Bennett contributed research.
byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and RON NIXON

headline.print_headline: Behind Long Airport Lines, a Chain of T.S.A. Cuts, Missteps and Crises
headline.main: Behind Long Airport Lines, a Chain of T.S.A. Cuts, Missteps and Crises

snippet: With the Transportation Security Administration struggling with shrinking resources and low staff morale, an expert said that “a structural change is needed.”
abstract: Many employees of Transportation Security Administration say anger at agency and its workers over long lines at airports is misdirected, as agency has been denied resources it needs to work efficiently in face of growing number of travelers.
